item.value: The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The heaviest apple weighed 1.849 kg (4 lb 1 oz) and was grown and picked by Chisato Iwasaki at his apple farm in Hirosaki City, Japan October 24, 2005.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'. It is 45 characters long.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
Elephants demonstrate concern for members of their families they take care of weak or injured members and appear to grieve over a dead companion.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.

English is the second most spoken language in the world.
Microsoft Windows was announced November 10, 1983.

Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press in 1436 . Gutenberg is also accredited with printing the world's first book known as the Gutenberg Bible.
